subject: Self Care
title: Reading Nonverbal Cues
description: A 60-second lesson on Reading Nonverbal Cues.

hook.text: She said 'I'm fine' with crossed arms, tight lips, and zero eye contact. The words said one thing. The body said another.

buildup.text: Albert Mehrabian's research suggested that up to 93% of emotional communication is nonverbal: tone and body language.

discovery.text: Micro-expressions â€” fleeting facial movements lasting under a second â€” reveal emotions people try to hide.

twist.text: Reading body language isn't about catching liars. It's about noticing discomfort so you can respond with care.

climax.text: Watch for clusters: crossed arms plus leaning away plus short answers. Single cues mislead. Patterns reveal truth.

punchline.text: Watch the body. It speaks louder than the words.

quiz.question: Why should you look for clusters of nonverbal cues?
options: Clusters create reliable patterns while single cues can mislead
